title:
Cycling and Fitness

** available as of 2023-07-01
description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students' knowledge and basic skills of cycling for physical activity participation. Cycling can help students to train their coordination and achieve physical fitness. Moreover, this course will encourage students to have lifelong participation in cycling.Contents of the course include: 1) basic skills of cycling including bicycle control, handling, turning, gear shifting, ascending and descending; 2) cycling gears and equipment; 3) safety in cycling and; 4) cycling fitness.

title: Special Physical Education I
requirements:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing and nurturing students with disabled conditions or special health problems the concepts of sports activities participation and choosing some sports activities for life long participation. title: Physical Conditioning (Men)
requirements:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1220.
description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental fitness concepts and an option as a lifelong activity. Contents include: basic concepts of physical fitness, exercise safety, basic techniques of using fitness room facilities, basic principles of exercise prescription, basic knowledge and techniques of fitness testing, fitness courses and the knowledge to choose the appropriate exercise mode, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
outcome: At the end of the course, students are able to1. perform the basic techniques of using fitness room facilities and exercise safely;2. use the most appropriate method to improve the fitness level;3. describe the basic concepts of physical fitness;4. administer the fitness testing and interpret the results accordingly;5. write the plan of exercise prescription on different fitness components including weight management in accordance with the basic principles;6. demonstrate positive attitudes and values toward life time participation of sports activities. 完成體能鍛鍊課程後，學生能夠1.      掌握運用健身室設備之基本技術並安全地運動；2.      運用最恰當的方法改善體能水平；3.      敍述體適能基本概念；4. 正確地進行各項體適能要素之測試，並懂得闡釋其測試結果；5. 按基本原則編寫各體適能要素之運動處方計劃 (包括體重控制)；6. 展示參與終身運動的正面態度及價值觀。
